case_theme: Using Your Notes to Construct a Message
background: Pedro receives positive reinforcement from family members.
pre_reasoning: In Solution-Focused Brief Therapy, the therapist uses an accepting ownership intervention.

dialog.text: My guess is, you have probably told yourself that before, haven’t you?
dialog.observation: Therapist prompts Pedro to reflect on past self-talk.

dialog.text: But this is different. What made it different this time?
dialog.reasoning: Therapist guides Pedro to explore the unique aspect of the current situation.

dialog.text: My mother told me. My grandmother and my granddaddy told me they were proud of me.
dialog.observation: Pedro shares receiving positive feedback from family members.

dialog.text: So, it sounds to me like you really respect and want to please them too.
dialog.reasoning: Therapist highlights Pedro's respect and motivation to please his family.

dialog.observation: Pedro agrees with the therapist's observation.

dialog.text: So, this time, you are saying, I’m really going to do it.
dialog.reasoning: Therapist reinforces Pedro's commitment to taking action.

dialog.text: Hmm. That’s really super. That’s fantastic that you are able to do that. That you respect and care enough about your mom and your grandparents—and yourself too. You care enough about yourself that you are going to keep yourself on track.
dialog.reasoning: Therapist praises Pedro's self-respect and motivation to stay on course.

post_reasoning: In Solution-Focused Brief Therapy, reviewing the miracle helps identify additional instances of success.
